intro: Calyptrochilum, commonly known as the hooded orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, where the labellum is hooded, giving it its common name. The plants typically have fleshy, fibrous roots and are adapted to grow in shaded, moist environments. Calyptrochilum species are found primarily in tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia. Their flowers often display vibrant colors and are pollinated by specific insects, contributing to their ecological significance.
